cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles WNW of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Bahamas, then curving north-northwest to parallel the southeast U.S. shoreline with greatest threat to the South Carolina–North Carolina coast before accelerating northeastward along the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / southern North Carolina coast (Myrtle Beach–Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida east coast from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the Northwestern Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning for the Dominican Republic, north coast of Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and Central & Southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through North Carolina is within the cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with gusts approaching hurricane strength possible Monday night into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft above normal tides possible along the Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches if the center tracks inland just south of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, producing flash flooding in low-lying terminal and access-road areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and the threat of a few tornadoes embedded in outer rain-bands during the passage.
